author: Odeinoichus
title: Your Mission, Should you Choose To Accept It...
review:
Set #71248 Mission: Impossible Level Pack: LEGO had some fairly strange ideas on what would make a decent level in LEGO Dimensions. Case in point they went for the license to make MI, the MI based on the feature film reboot and not the original television series. Granted Mission Impossible is still highly popular with a lot of people, but it is fairly action focused and a bit more adult in nature due to the source material. Still this is a Level Pack that brings Ethan Hunt into the Minifigure realm.

Packaging

The artwork on the front of the packaging shows off one of the most iconic scenes in Movie History with Ethan Hunt dangling on a zipline to crack into a computer. Other smaller scenes sprinkle the package all around and of course the Adventure World is shown on the back. Overall a very decent presentation for the set.

Parts

Not a lot of unique or rare elements found in this set. It’s still got a fun selection of parts to make the vehicle builds and the Toy Tags are highly collectible even if you don’t play the game because they make decent little figure and model stands.

Minifigures

Ethan Hunt: This is an awesome Minifigure. He’s got dual-molded arms for the short-sleeved look and is dressed in his iconic outfit from the scene in the first film when he was dangling over the floor to hack the computer. He also features dual-sided facial printing, one side with him wearing the glasses and head set, the other a plain stoic expression as he prepares to do something exciting, I’m sure.

He carries a pair of binoculars for an accessory and has the Toy Tag printed with M:I logo. There is no printing on the legs.

The build

IMF Scrambler: Building a tiny motorcycle as the first model lets you experience some of the fun ideas this set implements. It’s also pretty quick and works well as far as parts use goes.

ShockCycle: This secondary build is an alternate version of a motorcycle. It is an awkward design though after you’ve built it, it looks very odd to see the digital model being ridden in-game.

IMF Covert Jet: This third build is extremely intriguing and a very good re-use of parts.

IMF Sports Car: Much like the Spy Hunter car, this model is a real treat to build and you shouldn’t have any difficulty following the in-game pages to make the model.

IMF Tank: This build is a bit like a Wacky Racer. It uses the wheel rim parts for an odd design choice, but it is still a fun build and rather impressive.

The IMF-Splorer: This model is also fun in design, though the implementation could use a little work. The build was quick and easy and had no irritating moments.

The completed model

IMF Scrambler & Alternate Models: All three of these models are somewhat similar in design for a reason, they are all capable of holding a Minifigure. They are rather quirky in that respect because the Minifigure looks odd when it grips the handles, but all three models are fun to remove from the Toy Tag and play with them.

IMF Sports Car & Alternate Models: The main model of the Sports Car is very reminiscent of the Spy Hunter car, but it’s pretty nifty. The IMF Tank is curious and quirky and can smash through barriers, in your imagination mind you, the IMF-Splorer is just odd, but in a good way. Underwater vehicles are always curious.

The Digital Content

The Level: Re-Live the glories of the first Mission Impossible movie with Tom Cruise as Ethan Hunt journeys through the big action set pieces of the film. It’s a lengthy adventure and the level did not have any glitches or game breaking moments, which is nice, the puzzles were all solvable without much difficulty and everything just works.

The Adventure World: This is the meat and the potatoes of an excellent entrée. The Level was great, but the Adventure World is even better. You get to explore a vast area of European cities and solve quests and other play elements. Didn’t run into any glitches while playing here either, which is great, it’s always nice when levels and adventure worlds work as intended.

Battle Arena: Take on three of your friends or family members in the IMF Field Agent Training Facility, that’s pretty much all I’ve got. I don’t think I ever even visited this one while playing solo. I’m sure it’s a great level to explore and play in, as long as there aren’t any game breaking glitches.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Ethan Hunt is a spy and as a spy he gets to access a lot of abilities. He has Acrobat, Target, Stealth, X-Ray Vision and Technology abilities and introduces a few new ones. The Fuse Box ability is iconic as you must get through a maze before the stick of dynamite’s fuse explodes, it’s really impressive and plays the MI theme song every time. MagnoGloves allow you to grip items or interact with magnetic grapple points. In order to Destroy Silver LEGO Objects you get to use the famous stick of gum explosive, a tiny IMF drone will help you solve Drone Mazes and he can Dive as well. The Grapple ability is also there and Scan Disguise allows you to scan another character to access restricted areas while disguised.

The IMF Sports Car can use Accelerator Switches and Two-Bar, the IMF Tank adds the ability to Destroy Cracked LEGO Objects and Gold LEGO Objects and the IMF-Splorer let’s you use Underwater Drone and Underwater Interactions.

The IMF Scrambler can also access Accelerator Switches and features a Special Attack, it also has the Jump ability. The ShockCycle let’s you do all of the above while gaining the power to Destroy Silver LEGO Objects and has a Special Weapon. The third and final build, IMF Covert jet is a flying and underwater vehicle, as such you can interact with Flight Docks, Flight Cargo Hooks, Underwater Interactions, the Tow-Bar and retains the Special Weapon ability.

Overall opinion

I was a bit uncertain what to expect from this, but I find it to be one of my favorite packs from Series 2, it’s on my top five list for sure. The music cues, the clips of Tom Cruise, everything is just really impressive. I’d strongly recommend picking this one up, I mean how often are we going to get Tom Cruise as a Minifigure?

The models are great fun too and they enhance the digital content quite well. I think the only downside is that we couldn’t get a full Story Pack for this Theme to explore the entire franchise. It’d be nice to play condensed versions of all six movies…provided there were six movies to pull from, but I digress. Strongly Recommended.
